Package ohos.agp.components

Class TimePicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.StackLayout
          • ohos.agp.components.TimePicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentParent

    public class TimePicker
extends StackLayout
    Provides a time picker.

    This class can be used in countdown time selection. Either the 24-hour or 12-hour time mode can be selected.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  TimePicker.AmPmOrder
      Defines the display format of the column representing a.m.

      Provides a time change listener.

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT
        Indicates the default rotation sensitivity of TimePicker to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH
        Indicates the high rotation sensitivity of TimePicker to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_LOW

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_LOW
        Indicates the low rotation sensitivity of TimePicker to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.

      • isHourEnabled

        public boolean isHourEnabled​()

        Returns:

      • enableHour

        public void enableHour​(boolean enable)
        Sets whether to enable the hour selector.
        Parameters:
        enable - Specifies whether to enable the hour selector. The value true indicates that the hour selector is enabled, and the value false indicates that the hour selector is disabled.

        public void set24Hour​(boolean is24Hour)
        Sets whether to display the time in 24-hour mode.
        Parameters:
        is24Hour - Specifies whether the time is displayed in 24-hour mode. The value true indicates that the time is displayed in 24-hour mode, and the value false indicates that the time is not displayed in the 24-hour mode.

      • is24Hour

        public boolean is24Hour​()
        Obtains whether the time is displayed in 24-hour mode.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the time is displayed in 24-hour mode; returns false otherwise. The default value is true.

      • setTimeChangedListener

        public void setTimeChangedListener​(TimePicker.TimeChangedListener listener)
        Sets the listener TimePicker.TimeChangedListener to listen for the change of the selected time.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to listen for the change of the selected time.

      • setRange

        public void setRange​(int[] ranges)
        Sets the time range that can be selected. The time range is arranged in the array in the following sequence: start hour, start minute, start second, end hour, end minute, and end second.
        Parameters:
        ranges - Indicates the time range that can be selected.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid: if ranges is null or if ranges.length is not equal to 6 or if ranges[0] "starting hour" is less than 0 or bigger than 23 or if ranges[1] "starting minute" is less than 0 or bigger than 59 or if ranges[2] "starting second" is less than 0 or bigger than 59 or if ranges[3] "ending hour" is less than 0 or bigger than 23 or if ranges[4] "ending minute" is less than 0 or bigger than 59 or if ranges[5] "ending second" is less than 0 or bigger than 59.

      • getRange

        public void getRange​(int[] ranges)
        Obtains the time range that can be selected. The time range comes from the value assigned to the input array and is returned in the following sequence: start hour, start minute, start second, end hour, end minute, and end second.
        Parameters:
        ranges - Indicates the time range that can be selected.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid.

      • setWheelModeEnabled

        public void setWheelModeEnabled​(boolean isEnabled)
        Sets whether to enable wheel mode for the selector wheel of a time picker. If it is enabled, the maximum value wraps around the minimum value.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - Indicates whether to enable wheel mode. true indicates to enable the wheel mode; false indicates otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • isWheelModeEnabled

        public boolean isWheelModeEnabled​()
        Obtains whether wheel mode is enabled for the selector wheel of a time picker.
        Returns:
        Returns true if wheel mode is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setAmPmOrder

        public void setAmPmOrder​(TimePicker.AmPmOrder order)
        Sets the format of the column representing a.m. and p.m. in the time picker.

        The column representing a.m. and p.m. can be displayed at the start or in the end of the picker by specifying the value AmPmOrder#START or AmPmOrder#END. The direction (left-to-right or right-to-left) of AmPmOrder#START and AmPmOrder#END depends on specified Component.isRtl() value. The column can also be displayed on the left or right of the time picker by specifying AmPmOrder#LEFT or AmPmOrder#RIGHT.

        Parameters:
        order - Indicates the AmPmOrder enumeration value, which can be AmPmOrder#START, AmPmOrder#END, AmPmOrder#LEFT, or AmPmOrder#RIGHT.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if order parameter is null.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        TimePicker.AmPmOrder, getAmPmOrder(), set24Hour(boolean), setAmPmStrings(String, String)

      • getAmPmOrder

        public TimePicker.AmPmOrder getAmPmOrder​()
        Obtains the format of the column representing a.m. and p.m in the time picker.

        The column representing a.m. and p.m. can be displayed at the start or in the end of the picker by specifying the value AmPmOrder#START or AmPmOrder#END.The direction (left-to-right or right-to-left) of AmPmOrder#START and AmPmOrder#END depends on the specified Component.isRtl() value.

        Returns:
        Returns the AmPmOrder enumeration value, which can be AmPmOrder#START, AmPmOrder#END, AmPmOrder#LEFT, or AmPmOrder#RIGHT.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        TimePicker.AmPmOrder, setAmPmOrder(AmPmOrder), set24Hour(boolean), setAmPmStrings(String, String)
